alert.note: Alert for Central and South Weld County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 23 at 5:23PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...Strong outflow winds will impact portions of south central Weld and north central Adams Counties through 615 PM MDT... At 522 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong outflow winds from showers, along a line extending from 3 miles northwest of Riverside Reservoir to near Roggen to 3 miles west of Hudson, or along a line extending from 27 miles west of Fort Morgan to 23 miles south of Greeley. Movement was southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Brighton, Lochbuie, Hudson, Keenesburg, Prospect Valley, Riverside Reservoir and Roggen. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: Prepare for sudden gusty winds. Secure loose objects and move to a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
